intro: Ornithopus brevirostris, commonly known as the short-beaked salsify, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces cylindrical, ridged seed pods. Ornithopus brevirostris is characterized by its slender, upright stems and hairy leaves.
